title: Plushie Haven — adult plushie lover lifestyle website

requirements.text: Create the core frontend app for an adult plushie lover lifestyle website named “Plushie Haven”, including a responsive layout with header navigation, footer, and the following pages/sections with English user-facing text: Home (hero + intro), Articles/Guides (list + detail), Gallery (image grid), Community Board (posts list + create post), Events (upcoming list), About, and Contact (non-email form UI with copy-to-clipboard or mailto link).

quotes: Make an adult plushie lover lifestyle website, call it Plushie Haven

acceptanceCriteria: The site title/branding reads “Plushie Haven” throughout the UI (header, page title, and landing hero).
Navigation works across all listed pages/sections on mobile and desktop.
Articles/Guides page supports viewing an article list and an individual article detail view.
Gallery page displays an image grid with basic captions/alt text.
Community Board page displays a list of posts and a create-post form UI.
Events page displays a list of upcoming events (can be seeded content).
About and Contact pages render and are accessible from navigation.

requirements.text: Implement a consistent, distinctive visual theme for Plushie Haven (colors, typography, spacing, and UI styling) suitable for an adult lifestyle community; avoid a blue/purple-dominant palette. Apply the theme consistently across all pages and components.

quotes: Make an adult plushie lover lifestyle website, call it Plushie Haven

acceptanceCriteria: All pages share a cohesive design system (color palette, type scale, buttons/inputs, cards).
Theme is not primarily blue/purple.
Design feels “cozy / plush / lifestyle” while remaining clearly adult-oriented (not childlike).

requirements.text: Add an age confirmation gate for adult audiences: on first visit, require the user to confirm they are 18+ to enter Plushie Haven, with a persistent “confirmed” state stored locally in the browser.

quotes: Make an adult plushie lover lifestyle website, call it Plushie Haven

acceptanceCriteria: Users see an 18+ confirmation screen before accessing site content until they confirm.
After confirming, the user is not prompted again on refresh/revisit (unless they clear site data).
If the user declines, they cannot access the main site content.

requirements.text: Implement backend support for the Community Board: authenticated users can create, list, and view posts. Each post stores: id, author principal, author display name (optional), title, body, createdAt timestamp. Provide canister methods for createPost and listPosts (and getPost by id if needed for the UI).

quotes: Make an adult plushie lover lifestyle website, call it Plushie Haven

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes canister methods to create a post and list posts.
Posts persist across page reloads.
Each post includes author principal and createdAt data.

requirements.text: Integrate Internet Identity sign-in on the frontend and require authentication for creating Community Board posts; unauthenticated users can browse posts but must sign in to post.

quotes: Make an adult plushie lover lifestyle website, call it Plushie Haven

acceptanceCriteria: Users can sign in/out with Internet Identity.
Community Board post creation is disabled or prompts sign-in when the user is not authenticated.
Authenticated users can successfully create a post and see it appear in the list.

requirements.text: Seed the Articles/Guides and Events sections with curated static content appropriate for adult plushie enthusiasts (e.g., care tips, collecting, display ideas, travel/events etiquette), ensuring content remains safe and non-explicit.

quotes: Make an adult plushie lover lifestyle website, call it Plushie Haven

acceptanceCriteria: Articles/Guides contains at least 6 items with titles, short summaries, and full detail text.
Events contains at least 5 upcoming items with date and location fields (can be fictional).
Copy is adult-oriented but non-explicit and suitable for a general audience.

requirements.text: Generate and include required static brand images for Plushie Haven, store them in frontend/public/assets/generated, and use them in the UI (e.g., logo in header, hero image on home, subtle background pattern).

quotes: Make an adult plushie lover lifestyle website, call it Plushie Haven

acceptanceCriteria: All required generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced by the frontend.
Header displays the generated logo image.
Home page displays the generated hero/banner image.
A subtle generated pattern/texture is used in the site background or section backgrounds without harming readability.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead).

Do not modify immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
nonGoals: Real-time chat, WebSockets, or live messaging.
Third-party authentication providers other than Internet Identity.
External databases or third-party backend services.
Explicit adult content or pornography; the site should be adult-oriented but non-explicit.

required: Cozy plush-themed logo mark with text “Plushie Haven”, warm neutral palette, clean adult lifestyle aesthetic (plushie-haven-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Homepage hero banner illustration/photo-collage style featuring plush textures, soft lighting, and cozy interior vibes, no people, no explicit elements (plushie-haven-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
Seamless subtle background pattern inspired by plush fabric texture, low-contrast, tileable (plushie-haven-pattern.dim_1024x1024.png)
